intro: Fumana montana, commonly known as the mountain fumana, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its flowers are usually small and yellow or white, arranged in dense clusters. Fumana montana is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
